title: Russian Memo Said War Leaves Moscow Too Reliant on Chinese Tech
description: Senior Russian officials privately raised concerns some 10 months ago about the risks of becoming too dependent on Chinese technologies after sanctions by the US and the European Union shut off access to alternative suppliers.

title: Kim Jong Un Calls for Spy Satellite Launch in Face of US Threat
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un ordered the launch of a military spy satellite, a move that could allow him to keep an eye on US allies as well as advance his state’s ability to deliver a nuclear warhead to the American mainland.

title: Biden Tax Returns Show Income and Effective Rate Fell in 2022
description: President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden paid $169,820 in federal and state income tax on a combined $579,514 in adjusted gross income, according to their annual tax returns.

title: Australia Plans Fuel-Efficiency Standards to Encourage Electric Vehicle Use
description: Australia will introduce its first fuel-efficiency standards by the end of the year, as part of the government’s plans to encourage the use of electric vehicles and cut carbon emissions.

title: Ecuador’s President Hospitalized for Days as Impeachment Proceeds
description: Ecuador’s President Guillermo Lasso, who’s been hospitalized since the weekend suffering from a high fever and a severe urinary infection, is expected to be released Friday, the presidency said in a statement sent by text message.

title: Scottish National Party Treasurer Released Without Charge, Police Say
description: SNP treasurer Colin Beattie has been released without charge, after he became the second figure in the party to be arrested in connection with a police investigation into the party's finances.

title: Biden Slams McCarthy’s Wall Street Debt Speech as Risking Default
description: President Joe Biden blasted the proposals House Speaker Kevin McCarthy offered in a speech to Wall Street, saying the Republican plan would slash benefits for the working and middle classes while causing economic chaos.

title: Rapper Pras Michel Says Jho Low Was ‘Too Hot’ for Obama Campaign
description: Grammy-winning rapper Pras Michel began defending himself Tuesday at his illegal-lobbying trial, telling jurors that the party-boy image of Malaysian tycoon Jho Low — once a friend and now a fugitive — was “too hot” to get an invite to a 2012 fundraiser for then-President Barack Obama.

title: ‘Alternate’ Trump Electors in Georgia Saw Illegal Acts, DA Says
description: Some of Georgia’s “alternate” 2020 electors have told prosecutors that one group member engaged in illegal conduct, according to a court filing by the district attorney investigating President Donald Trump’s efforts to change the state’s election outcome.

title: US Urges Korea, Japan to Follow Through on Summit Deal to Mend Strained Ties
description: A top US official urged Japan and South Korea to follow through with commitments to repair strained ties while saying the Biden administration should resist the urge to become more involved in diplomacy between two key allies.

title: Mexico’s AMLO Accuses Pentagon of Spying, Dialing Up Tensions With US
description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador ratcheted up the political infighting with the US by saying Tuesday his country has been a target of espionage by the Pentagon.

title: G-7’s Nuclear Fuel Pact Offers Boost for Canadian Uranium Deals
description: A Group of Seven pact aimed at weakening Russia’s influence on the nuclear energy market will likely bolster Canada’s own industry, Natural Resources Minister Jonathan Wilkinson said.

title: Trump Is George Washington, King of Hearts in Second Round of NFTs
description: Donald Trump is back to hawking digital trading cards.

title: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot Says Budget Deficits Are Narrowing
description: Chicago expects narrower deficits over the next couple of years thanks largely to a rapid economic recovery, outgoing Mayor Lori Lightfoot said in a mid-year budget forecast.

title: 51% of Brits Believe Government Should Not Fund Coronation, Poll Suggests
description: More than half of Britons do not think the King's coronation should be funded by the Government, a new poll suggests.

title: How Sinn Fein’s Rise Is Shaking Up Ireland’s Politics
description: Rooted in its campaign for a united Ireland, Sinn Fein was long an outsider in politics due to its links with the Irish Republican Army. With the conflict in Northern Ireland largely over since a 1998 peace deal, the movement has reinvented itself to appeal to a new generation of voters. Now, in a historic shift, it has become the biggest party in the north and also leads opinion polls in the Irish Republic to the south. That makes its demand for a referendum on unification harder to ignore.

title: McConnell Opposes Replacing Ailing Dianne Feinstein on Judiciary Committee
description: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell says Republicans will oppose a Democratic plan to temporarily replace an ailing and absent Senator Dianne Feinstein on the Judiciary Committee, a position that keeps a cluster of President Joe Biden’s judicial nominees stalled.

title: NATO Seeks Deal With China Over ‘Responsible Use’ of Military AI
description: NATO wants to strike a deal with China over rules outlining the responsible use of artificial intelligence and other disruptive technologies in the military domain, the alliance’s chief Jens Stoltenberg said Tuesday.

title: Tunisia Leader Vows ‘Relentless War’ After Top Opponent Detained
description: Tunisia’s president vowed a “relentless war” against those he claimed were damaging the country, signaling a possible escalation in the crackdown against opponents shortly after the detention of his most vocal critic.

title: House Republicans Plan to Vote on Debt Limit, Spending Cuts Next Week
description: House Republicans are planning to vote next week on a bill that would raise the US debt ceiling and enact deep cuts to spending, lawmakers said emerging from a morning conference meeting on Capitol Hill.

title: Scotland’s Troubled New Leader Faces Daunting Economic Reality
description: Scottish First Minister Humza Yousaf set out his plan to reduce poverty, support small businesses and use all his government’s power to mitigate the effects of what he called the UK’s failed economic model.

title: DeSantis Made Florida Richer, Now He’s Making It Redder
description: The potential presidential contender has remodeled his state as a conservative citadel, even as Republicans grow fearful of alienating moderate voters

title: 21 Dead in Beijing Hospital Fire, Dozens Evacuated
description: BEIJING (AP) — Twenty-one people have died in a fire at a Beijing hospital that forced the evacuation of dozens of patients, Chinese state media reported.

title: Why Clarence Thomas Faces Little Risk in Supreme Court Ethics Fight
description: US Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas is under scrutiny over his acceptance of financial largesse from Harlan Crow, a Texas billionaire who supports conservative business causes. Thomas didn’t disclose trips paid for by Crow or the sale of property to Crow, as required under post-Watergate ethics laws that also apply to presidents, members of Congress and some other federal officials. Yet there is little chance Thomas faces recourse, because unlike other US branches and agencies, the Supreme

title: Ecuador Leader Threatens to Dissolve Congress Over Impeachment
description: Ecuador’s President Guillermo Lasso said he will dissolve congress if he faces removal in the current impeachment trial, escalating a political fight with opposition lawmakers.

title: Russia Court Rejects WSJ Reporter’s Appeal of Spying Arrest
description: The Moscow City Court Tuesday rejected an appeal by Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich against his detention on allegations of espionage in a high-profile case that’s highlighted the growing pressure on journalists in Russia.

title: Sunak Must ‘Come Clean’ and Publish Financial Interests, Demands Starmer
description: Rishi Sunak must "come clean" and publish his financial interests while under investigation over a possible failure to make a declaration to MPs, Sir Keir Starmer has demanded.

title: Pentagon Cites China’s Military Threat as Beijing Spurns Calls to Talk
description: A senior US defense official will warn lawmakers about the growing risks of Chinese military power, while highlighting China’s continued refusal to engage in high-level talks with the Pentagon.

title: A Third of Thais Still Undecided Weeks Before Vote, Survey Shows
description: One-third of Thai voters are still undecided about their choice of political parties ahead of the May 14 general election, with opposition parties holding a clear edge over the ruling military-backed coalition, according to a nationwide survey.

title: UAE, Qatar Edge Toward Reopening Embassies
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Qatar and the United Arab Emirates on Tuesday both acknowledged they are edging closer to reopening embassies in each others' countries after a yearslong boycott of Doha over a political dispute.

title: Japan Government to Use ChatGPT for First Time on Red Tape
description: Japan is using OpenAI’s ChatGPT to try and make its often opaque and complex government regulations easier to understand.

title: Why China’s Xi Still Isn’t Calling Zelenskiy
description: Nearly 14 months after Russia invaded Ukraine, Chinese President Xi Jinping has yet to pick up the phone to call President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

title: Foreigners, Diplomats Targeted in Attacks by Fighters in Sudan
description: Fighters in Sudan’s capital targeted buildings occupied by diplomats and international humanitarian agency staff since violence erupted in the North African nation on Saturday, the United Nations said.

title: China’s Top Envoy to Visit Philippines Amid US Alliance Push
description: China’s Foreign Minister Qin Gang will visit the Philippines this week to boost ties and tackle regional security issues as the Southeast Asian nation bolsters its defense alliance with the US.

title: EU Calls for Coherent China Stance After Macron Sowed Doubts
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen called on the European Union to maintain a common position toward China after French President Emmanuel Macron sparked outrage by suggesting that the bloc should avoid being dragged into a dispute with Beijing by the US.

title: Sudan Paramilitary Group Agrees to 24-Hour Humanitarian Truce
description: Sudan’s Rapid Support Forces, a paramilitary group that has been fighting against the army for control of the North African nation, said it agreed to a 24-hour humanitarian truce.

title: Afghan Economy on Verge of Collapse If Aid Drops, UN Warns
description: The United Nations made a renewed appeal for international aid for Afghanistan, warning that a cut in funding in response to the Taliban government banning women from education and jobs would perpetuate extreme poverty that lasts for decades.

title: SNP Treasurer Colin Beattie Arrested in Party Finance Probe
description: SNP treasurer Colin Beattie has been arrested in connection with a police investigation into the party's finances.

title: Scottish Police Arrest Second Man in Probe Into SNP Finances
description: Police in Scotland arrested a second man as part of an ongoing investigation into the Scottish National Party’s finances.

title: Ukraine Says Crop Shipments Are Disrupted for a Second Day
description: Ukraine said its crop shipments through the Black Sea safe-passage corridor remained suspended for a second day, disputing an earlier report out of Russia and adding to uncertainty about the future of supplies from one of the world’s key agricultural exporters.

title: Macron Wants China’s Help to Bring Russia, Ukraine to the Table
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is looking to reverse a string of disappointing diplomatic forays by approaching China with a plan that he believes could potentially lead to talks between Russia and Ukraine.

title: UK Nurseries Say Jeremy Hunt’s Child Care Plans Won’t Work
description: Funding shortfalls, limited free care hours and a failure to tackle employers’ prejudice could keep would-be working parents stuck at home.

title: Japan Bomb Suspect May Have Held Grudge Over Election System
description: The man suspected of throwing an explosive device at Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida may have nursed a grudge against the election system and the ruling party’s ties to a fringe religion, local media reports said.

title: Ukraine Latest: Putin Visits Russian Troops; G-7 Pledges Support
description: Vladimir Putin visited troops in the occupied part of Ukraine’s Kherson and Luhansk regions, marking the Russian president’s second public visit to the occupied territories since he ordered the February 2022 invasion.

title: Jailed US Reporter Evan Gershkovich Appears in Russian Court to Appeal Detention
description: Jailed American journalist Evan Gershkovich appeared in a Moscow court on Tuesday to appeal his detention on spying charges, part of a sweeping Kremlin crackdown on dissent amid the war in Ukraine. He and the U.S. government strenuously deny the allegations.

title: Bangladesh Garment Factories Face Fire Risk as Temperatures Soar
description: Bangladesh’s garment factories, a key source of foreign exchange for the South Asian nation, face the heightened risk of fires as summer temperatures soar, an industry lobby group warned.

title: Putin Stages Surprise Visit to Troops in Occupied Ukraine
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin visited troops in two occupied regions of Ukraine, according to video released Tuesday by the Kremlin, marking the second time in a month he’s toured territory seized in the more than year-old invasion.

title: Bangladesh to Pay Russia $300 Million in Yuan for Nuclear Plant
description: Bangladesh has agreed to pay Russia about $300 million in yuan currency to settle payment for building a nuclear power plant near the capital city Dhaka, according to two officials familiar with the matter.

title: China Must Show Intention to Keep Engaging With US, Blinken Says
description: China must make clear its intentions to keep engaging with the US, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, as the world’s biggest economies struggle to move past a spat over the shooting down of an alleged Chinese spy balloon in February.

title: Liberia Opposition Banks on Soaring Food Prices to Unseat Weah
description: Discontent in Liberia over soaring food prices and shortages of basic goods is posing a threat to President George Weah, who is losing support ahead of his bid for reelection later this year.

title: Blinken Says US Diplomatic Convoy Fired Upon in Sudan, All Safe
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said a US diplomatic convoy in Sudan was fired upon in a “reckless” act, adding all the people in the group were safe.

title: China’s Defense Minister Lauds Putin for ‘Promoting World Peace’
description: China’s defense minister congratulated Russian leader Vladimir Putin for “promoting world peace,” underscoring the warm relations between the two nations more than a year after Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Expat Students At Hong Kong Schools Decline 12% Amid Exodus
description: The number of non-local students at Hong Kong international schools has fallen 12% in four years, reflecting the wave of expatriate departures during the pandemic.

title: Singapore Central Bank Head Menon Set to Leave; Chia Taking Top Job
description: Ravi Menon, the Monetary Authority of Singapore’s longest-serving chief, is poised to leave the central bank this year, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: G-7 to Back Ukraine Indefinitely, Seeks Stability With China
description: The Group of Seven nations vowed to support Ukraine for “as long as it takes” in its fight against Russian forces, while also calling for greater engagement with China to stabilize relations with the world’s second-biggest economy.

title: Biden Speaks to Black Teenager Shot After He Rang a Doorbell
description: President Joe Biden spoke Monday with Ralph Yarl, the Black teenager who was shot last week after ringing the wrong doorbell.

title: Trudeau Team ‘Closely’ Watching Glencore’s Bid to Swallow Teck
description: One of Justin Trudeau’s senior cabinet ministers said Canada is monitoring Glencore Plc’s attempted takeover of Teck Resources Ltd., pointing out the country benefits from having major companies headquartered domestically.

title: Bali Wants to Tax Tourists After Crackdown on Misbehavior
description: Indonesia is considering a tourism levy for visitors to Bali, adding another potential hurdle for holidaymakers after the island cracked down on traffic and visa breaches.

title: Landmark Same-Sex Marriage Hearings Begin at India’s Top Court
description: India’s Supreme Court is set to begin hearing arguments for granting legal recognition to same-sex marriages in a crucial case that will decide the fate of marital and allied rights for lesbian and gay couples in the 1.4 billion-strong South Asian nation.

title: How Imran Khan’s Poll Demand Sparked a New Pakistan Crisis
description: Former Pakistan premier Imran Khan’s bid for snap elections has evolved into a constitutional crisis, with the government pushing back against a Supreme Court order to carry out two provincial polls, raising concerns over the future of the democratic process.
